channel.title: 1Upsmanship
channel.description: Michael likes story-driven games with lots of contemplative moral quandaries and inventory management. Adam likes action-driven FPS games with gorgeous graphics and no down-time. Together, their friendship is constantly on the verge of ruin! But you can watch it all crumble before your very ears on 1Upsmanship, the pod where two lifelong gamers run one game an episode through the crucible to determine if it belongs on the Celestial Hard Drive. GAME ON.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Arcaxer (Feat. Anthony Graceffa and Aaron Lutes)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Arcaxer (Feat. Anthony Graceffa and Aaron Lutes)
item.description:
Shipheads, meet Anthony and Aaron, VR devs with a new game to show off and fascinating insights into the unique space in which they work. Arcaxer is VR’s first turn-based RPG. We dive into how they came up with such a wild idea, went about accomplishing it, and the trials and travails of trying to market the thing now that it exists. Visor up and let’s see what the next evolution of gaming looks like (spoilers: it involves running on a treadmill and then vomiting).

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Mega Man X (Feat. Seanbaby)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Mega Man X (Feat. Seanbaby)
item.description:
Joined by the internet’s own Seanbaby (@Seanbabydotcom) of 1900-Hot-Dogg and Cracked notoriety, the celestial debate continues with a deep dive on everybody’s favorite super fighting robot, Mega Man who slapped on some new gear and a fresh coat of paint in his first big outing on the SNES. Things get heated when our heroes clash over the game’s difficulty, how much this franchise steals from others, and whether getting the Hadoken is Mega Man’s ultimate power upgrade. Listen now to gain all our powers!

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Dishonored
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Dishonored
item.description:
Our heroes zip rooftop to rooftop over the grim streets of Dunwall, discussing all the important questions raised by one of the most creative franchises in recent video game history. How much does this game really owe to Bioshock?  Is stealth the only viable approach? Wait, Susan Sarandon is in this? Should every game consider making you lord of rats? Hop aboard, Ship Heads, this one’s a whale of a time!

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Celestial Hard Drive Update 2.0
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Celestial Hard Drive Update 2.0
item.description:
It’s that time of the year again! Michael and Adam decided to kick 2023 off with a bang and discuss the State of the Drive. In this special once-a-year extravaganza they each revisit five hard drive decisions they’d like reconsidered. Things get surprisingly heated as the two friends argue about whether they need to discuss Psychonauts ever again, whether the Hard Drive needs a morality clause, and whether being first or the most fine-tuned is more important for a game’s legacy. Major game franchises get slandered! Fundamental drive assumptions get patched out! It’s a must-download update for all our listeners!

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Game of the Year 2022
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Game of the Year 2022
item.description:
The fellas cap off their first season at iHeart with the traditional ranking of their favorite games of the year-slash-airing of grievances. Elden Ring might even be mentioned; who’s to say? If all the “traditional” outlets let you down on the GOTY front, give this episode a spin. If nothing else, shipheads can trust Michael and Adam to give their unvarnished opinions on what made an impact and what fell flat, no matter how unorthodox or unsupported by the facts. Agree or disagree, hopefully it makes for some interesting conversation and a solid look back at how the medium advanced in 2022. 


To those looking to connect via Discord, you can join the Small Beans server by following this link - https://discord.gg/bJrUm5w2P5

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: God of War Ragnarök
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: God of War Ragnarök
item.description:
Kratos, Loki, Freya and all the other knuckleheads from God of War (2018) return to complete the Norse Saga. Did one of the most-anticipated games of 2022 live up to the hype? Mike and Adam are happy to explain to you why no, it did not. “Happy” might not be the right word. Exasperated? Livid? The boys get really bent outta shape in this one, guys. Let’s all listen to their ramblings and nod along before they unleash their spartan rage and destroy the studio.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: The Wolf Among Us
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: The Wolf Among Us
item.description:
The game is afoot in Fabletown, and someone’s out to get ahead…or two. Your very own gaming detectives Tweedle Swaim and Tweedle Ganz set out to determine whether Telltale’s decision-driven adaptation of Bill Willingham’s stellar Fables comics belongs on our Celestial Hard Drive. Will you side with Mike or Adam? Either way, they will remember that.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Super Mario 64 (Feat. Daemon Hatfield)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Super Mario 64 (Feat. Daemon Hatfield)
item.description:
Joined by Daemon Hatfield, host of IGN’s Gamescoop, our heroes reflect on Mario’s first major foray into the 3D gaming, and the moment where he finally found his voice. How did Nintendo triple-jump over everybody’s expectations and nail it on their first try? Why aren’t there more 3D platforming games? What else is there to say about one of the most important video games of all time? Hopefully we figured out something, cause this thing’s almost an hour. Spoilers: We did. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Interview with Game Designer: Charlie Cleveland
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Interview with Game Designer: Charlie Cleveland
item.description:
One of our most esteemed guests, the designer of Subnautica and new miniature RTS game Moonbreaker, Charlie Cleveland stops by to talk about the design process, his long term goals and experiences as a designer, following up on the success of Subnautica, and how to deal with valid criticisms on a release. You can check out his new game Moonbreaker in Early Release on Stream. Join us for a great conversation about how games are made!

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare (2007)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare (2007)
item.description:
Perched high in their AC-130, Mike and Adam revisit the subject of Call of Duty’s legacy through the night-visioned lens of one of the franchise’s greatest entries. Hard truth bombs get dropped! Friendly fire gets briefly tolerated! But will Modern Warfare finally breach the fortified walls of the Celestial Hard Drive? Join us on this special mission and find out. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Half-Life: Alyx (Feat. Brian Brushwood)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Half-Life: Alyx (Feat. Brian Brushwood)
item.description:
Brian Brushwood of Modern Rogue and the World’s Greatest Con podcast pops on a headset and bumps virtual fists with your fearless heroes as they come together to cover Valve’s pinnacle VR experience! Before the G-Man stuffs them all back into stasis, they’ll finally determine whether there’s a viable path forward for the medium or it’s just a passing fad that gives most people motion sickness. VRoooooom!

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Half Life 2 (Feat. Mark Lentz)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Half Life 2 (Feat. Mark Lentz)
item.description:
What? Back-to-back Half Life? That’s right Shipheads, we know what you like and this Halloween we decided you deserve a treat. Mike and Adam are joined by Mark Lentz, a video game developer who worked on the recent indie hit Cursed to Golf, to discuss the towering legacy of one of video games’ most beloved sequels, Half Life 2. Will Mike finally finish mocking the Smoking Man? Will the boys forgive the sequel’s profound refusal to clarify the story? Will we ever get tired of using the gravity gun? I mean…the answer to all these questions is no, but if you want to know the answer to the most important question of all, whether this game makes it to the celestial hard drive, you’ll have to listen all the way to the end. Enjoy!

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Half Life
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Half Life
item.description:
Grab your crowbar and conveniently pre-charged HEV suit Shipheads, cause we’re tearing down the fabric of reality and changing the course of human (and gaming) history! Join Mike and Adam as they talk about the enormous legacy of Half Life, the series’s unfinished story, and whether it holds up by modern gaming standards. (Spoilers: Adam played Half Life for the first time a month ago). 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Alien: Isolation (Feat. David Bell)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Alien: Isolation (Feat. David Bell)
item.description:
Shh! The 1Ups boys and Gamefully Unemployed’s own David Christopher Bell are huddled up trying not to get Xenomorphed. Actually, you know what? Just get in here. It’s safer, plus it smells like dude. We’ll talk about Alien: Isolation, a seminal survival-horror adventure and potentially the greatest film-franchise-to-video-game adaptation of all time. Well, Dave thinks so, anyway.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Dead Space 2 (Feat. Tom Reimann)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Dead Space 2 (Feat. Tom Reimann)
item.description:
Our heroes are joined by their longtime friend and collaborator Tom Reimann to discuss the second installment of the space horror/action RPG franchise, Dead Space. It’s an undeniably polished and action-packed sequel, but does that make it better than the original? What exactly does the Marker want, and does it matter if that’s clear to the player? Did the franchise take the right direction by toning down the scares? Will Tom rip Adam’s arm off and use it to spear this game onto the celestial hard drive forever using his Kinesis module? Hint: at least one of these questions gets objectively answered. Double hint: it’s the franchise direction one. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Inscryption
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Inscryption
item.description:
Seriously, what the hell is this game? That would be an appropriate question to ask, dear listener.  So appropriate, in fact, that our hosts were still asking it weeks after they’d finished the game.  Join Mike and Adam as they discuss this devious and spooky little deckbuilding game that transcends the boundaries of video game development, storytelling, and even the file structure on your personal hard-drive to become…one of our favorite games of all time? Wow, really? Huh. I guess that’s true. I mean we’d never lie in our intro paragraph. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Stardew Valley (Feat. Maggie Mae Fish)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Stardew Valley (Feat. Maggie Mae Fish)
item.description:
Joined by returning guest Maggie Mae Fish, the 1ups crew explores yet another ChoreSim/faRmPG game designed by one brilliant, determined, and decidedly strange person. But can this adorably weird indie game keep up with the big boys like Animal Crossing and Harvest Moon, or will it take a couple swings, get tired, and have to sleep at like 10am? Strap on your listening tools and dive into the videogame mines with us. Yes, the game has mines.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Mass Effect
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Mass Effect
item.description:
Our courageous gamerbois brave alien technology, uncertain terrain, and the wrath of the internet as they discuss the first entry in Bioware’s beloved Mass Effect franchise. Sure, it’s important, sure it’s monumental, sure Wrex is one of the greatest characters in videogame history, but does it belong on the drive? Find out if our hosts went Paragon or full Renegade on this special episode!

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: The Return of the Obra Dinn
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: The Return of the Obra Dinn
item.description:
Adam and Mike tackle the surprisingly lurid and dangerous world of an insurance claims adjuster who’s investigating the mysterious reappearance of a lost clipper ship. What happened to the crew? Is the Captain actually John Wick? Will this 1-bit indie darling actually change Adam’s AAA ways? Will Lucas Pope submit to our heroes' shameful shilling and be on a future 1upsmanship episode? Unfortunately our magic timepiece doesn’t tell the future, but we feel pretty sure about this prediction: You’re in for a treat. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:
The co-captains of the S.S. 1Upsmanship steer us into indier waters, taking a closer look at adorable and surprisingly tough Zelda-like Tunic. Will its mute fox hero win over our cold-hearted hosts? item.title: 1Upsmanship: Top 10 Video Game Antagonists
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Top 10 Video Game Antagonists
item.description:
Adam and Mike take a break from antagonizing each other and rank the heroes and legends who did it best. It's time to announce our Top Ten Video Game Antagonists of all time! Predict the picks, root for your favorites, and scream obscenities aloud when we inevitably rank wrong.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Outer Wilds
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Outer Wilds
item.description:
In this banjo-playing, space-exploring, puzzle-solving episode our heroes contemplate such expansive subjects as the heat death of the universe, the human need for eternity, the value of a simplified narrative conclusion, and why are there giant fish in space? Mike and Adam probe the depths and heights of a meticulously crafted puzzle and traversal indie classic, Outer Wilds, all in the service of preserving its joys and pains for future generations. Of aliens, to be clear. We’re not getting off this rock alive. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time
item.description:
It's a big one. Some might say the biggest one of all. And to mark the occasion Adam and Mike slip on their iron boots and plumb the depths of one of 3D gaming's early masterpieces. So grab your bloated time flute and play along as our heroes consider important questions like "What was the Deku Tree's plan for Link anyway?", "Does Legend of Zelda have a memorable story or not? and "Fuck the Water Temple, right?" Can the hard drive's destiny really depend on such lazy boys? Yeah, probably.  

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: SeaFrog (Feat. Tyler Maitland)
item.description:

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Tiny Tina's Wonderlands
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Tiny Tina's Wonderlands
item.description:
Open wide for a fresh 1Up, baybeh! What starts as a deep dive into the latest installment in the Borderlands franchise ends up becoming a wide-ranging debate on the state of the modern looter-shooter, not to mention an object lesson in how to fight about video games then make up. Hooray emotional growth!

item.title: 1Upsmanship - Braid
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship - Braid
item.description:
Adam and Mike address a classic indie darling and it answers only in the form of weird time-bending platform mechanics and a story that's either about a breakup or nuclear holocaust. Did the boys dig Braid? Smash that play button and you'll be one step closer to that forbidden knowledge.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Call of Duty, WWII
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Call of Duty, WWII
item.description:
Backlog Episode!

Adam and Michael turn a stupid shooting game into a shockingly deep conversation, as they are wont to do. It's kind of crazy. Topics include Call of Duty, propaganda in narrative, free speech versus empathy, verisimilitude and historical obligation, and zombie mode.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Cyberpunk 2077 - Next Gen Update
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Cyberpunk 2077 - Next Gen Update
item.description:
Fresh out of their ripperdoc's basement, Mike and Adam turned around and stumbled right back in for a second snip. They felt their anger levels about the terrible launch of this game could use some cyber-reduction, and maybe a fresh pair of Kiroshi optics might help them evaluate the game in it's "finished" state . So they played the whole thing. Again. But did they enjoy their latest trip to Night City or are they blue-pilling Keanu's Silverhand back into irrelevant oblivion? Or...are they just gonna do a bunch more Matrix jokes? Hey we're not the Oracle, we just tell you what you need to hear. Follow the white rabbit and listen!

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Horizon: Forbidden West (Feat. Jason Pargin)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Horizon: Forbidden West (Feat. Jason Pargin)
item.description:
Aloy's pushing her way ever-deeper into what we're pretty sure is a tiny-sized representation of the contiguous United States, and we're right along for the ride! Michael and Adam welcome long-time friend Jason Pargin back to the show to discuss the follow-up they've been explicitly waiting for ever since Zero Dawn dropped. Did the promise they sensed from this franchise pay out?

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Gone Home (Feat. Vanessa Guererro)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Gone Home (Feat. Vanessa Guererro)
item.description:
Our heroes explore an empty and definitely scary house in the woods only to discover one of the most compelling love stories in video game history!! Joined by returning and celebrated guest Vanessa Guererro, the gang bonds over the depth, storytelling, and nostalgia in this little indie classic. It got real y'all. There's even some open-mouthed crying and a plan to dye each others hair that was... unfortunately cut for time. But it happened. Trust us. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Game Mechanics That Should Be In More Games
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Game Mechanics That Should Be In More Games
item.description:
Ever play a videogame and think "I would LOVE to have a grappling hook in this"? Adam and Mike go back and forth sharing their favorite videogame mechanics and why they should be featured in more games. Smash that play button to see if YOUR favorite mechanics make the list!

item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Halo - Combat Evolved
item.description:
It's the Citizen Kane of cover-based first-person shooters with robust multiplayer and vehicles! Adam and Mike take on the original Halo, and trace its impact through Destiny and all the way to Destiny 2, if you can believe it.

item.title: 1Upsmanship - Animal Crossing: New Horizons (Feat. Maggie Mae Fish)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship - Animal Crossing: New Horizons (Feat. Maggie Mae Fish)
item.description:
What do you get when you cross animals with just kind of hanging out? An activity some -- including the inimitable Maggie Mae Fish -- consider a full-on game, actually, thank you very much. Our hosts dig for fossils, chop wood, and talk shop, all to finally determine whether the game that took the whole world by storm at the start of the pandemic is...you know, "good."

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship - Elden Ring
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship - Elden Ring
item.description:
A new day has dawned, and that means it's time for Michael Swaim and Adam Ganser to level up and present 1Upsmanship to you afresh with a very special Elden Ring ep! Our intrepid heroes have a new theme song, a whole new attitude, and even a new format that's been re-tooled so slightly as to confuse both old fans and new listeners alike. What hasn't changed is the topic, so let's get to it (it's video games, by the way)! 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: The Hard Drive Episode
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: The Hard Drive Episode
item.description:
The hosts decided to take a review of the celestial hard drive. How does it work? What’s on it? How much space does it have? You see, we’ve been real lax about this in the past and this bit needs codification. With help from fellow Small Bean, askingseven, a list of all the “keeps” has been drafted and now the hosts must answer for their thought crimes.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Sifu
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Sifu
item.description:
Adam and Michael discuss the crunchy combat of this year’s Sifu by Sloclap! Both hosts found the game’s ability to create the feeling of becoming powerful incredibly satisfying. Unfortunately for them, it isn’t real fighting and they’re both still wimps in real life. Seriously, you could probably just push Swaim over and he’d just say “Left Stick Up, Left Stick Up + X.”

item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: New Pokemon Snap
item.description:
Hana Michels, who makes cat buttholes on Etsy and is a celebrated Small Bean, joins the pod for a special episode about cramming tiny animals into balls. They discuss the limits of the Pokemon lore, their shared joy of pelting things with apples, and Hana asserts her dominance as the one true trainer.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Halo Infinite
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Halo Infinite
item.description:
Michael is the Halo hater. Adam is the Halo lover. This episode they talk about Halo Infinite and 343 Industries in some kind of red vs. blue deathmatch. See who wins the podcast. I bet it’s Adam. I don’t know why, that guy just seems like he has his shit together.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Deathloop (Feat. David Bell)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Deathloop (Feat. David Bell)
item.description:
We brought David Bell, big bean and famous pervert, to come talk about one of our GOTYs: Deathloop, a first person shooter with a groundhog day twist. All the 1Uppers enjoy this title and discuss what made it compelling. Is its simplicity a feature or a bug? How did the hosts’ play styles differ? Michael mined the story and embraced the puzzle structure. Adam shot all the people with impressive precision. Dave found a way to make AI do all the work. This all makes sense.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship - Marvel’s Spider-Man: Miles Morales
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship - Marvel’s Spider-Man: Miles Morales
item.description:
It’s time to cover the Miles Morales game! Michael and Adam discuss Insomniac Games’ influence on the zeitgeist of Spidey. Michael thinks Peter Parker is done, Miles is the new hotness. Adam thinks sequels have become something companies just do for the next gen consoles and this all takes too long. So let’s get all caught up in the web of conversation that is 1Upsmanship. Let’s listen to these gooey white takes.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:
Our hosts end the year with their Top 5 Games of the Year! While this isn’t a review show, we thought we’d take a moment to tell y’all our picks. It was a great year and we won’t spoil their picks so just put our sound beans in your hear beans.

item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Psychonauts 2 (Feat. Vanessa Guerrero)
item.description:
On the most important episode of 1Upsmanship yet, the hosts have Vanessa Guerrero on to discuss the cult hit Psychonauts 2. Vanessa, like Michael, loves this series. Adam thinks “it’s definitely a sequel.” Get ready for the what we’re already calling internally “the “‘Raz’zle-dazzle.” Also, witness a historic Speed Run.

item.title: 1Upsmanship - Call of Duty: Warzone
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship - Call of Duty: Warzone
item.description:
This episode Adam has a secret agenda and forces Michael to cover a Call of Duty. They talk about the casual gaming aspect of the game, the try-hard competitive mentality, the battle royale format, and the children of Call of Duty. Oh, the children. With their open mics. Screaming into oblivion.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: The Forgotten City (Feat. Zachary Ryan)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: The Forgotten City (Feat. Zachary Ryan)
item.description:
Zach introduces us to a unique title this time. A time-loop based, existential mystery game developed by a team of only six or so designers based on a Skyrim mod. Gameplay mostly involves deciphering the larger mystery by altering your choices each loop. While time-loop games are in this year, the group discusses the uniqueness of this title, it’s ethical dilemmas, and the value of fables in gaming. So make sure you listen, then once you finish the episode, go ahead and listen to it again. You’ll get new information each time, I swear.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Resident Evil Village (Feat. Jason Pargin)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Resident Evil Village (Feat. Jason Pargin)
item.description:
Big Bean Jason Pargin, award-winning writer and professional podcaster, drops a deuce! By that we of course mean that he joins us for a second episode in a row! This time around the beans tackle the 8th installment of the Resident Evil franchise. They discuss the scares, the development of the series over time, and why don’t they allow you to kill that baby? I mean, that baby needs to die. Why won’t you let us kill the baby?

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship - Ratchet & Clank: Rift Apart
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship - Ratchet & Clank: Rift Apart
item.description:
Big Bean Jason Pargin drops by to discuss the PS5 platformer Ratchet & Clank: Rift Apart, the new PS5 installment in the series by Insomniac Games. The gang discusses the game’s ability to immerse you, the mechanical flaws of the game, and if the chaotic action of the game distracts from the narrative. Everything you’d expect from three men discussing a game about a feline mechanic and his awful robot.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Returnal
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Returnal
item.description:
A unique game by many accounts: released as the first PS5 only major release during a pandemic and with few PS5s actually around. The boys discuss it’s repetitiveness and the uniqueness of a roguelike FPS Triple-A psychological horror game. Is this a new genre? Is this just Risk of Rain 2? Is the story anything? Adam says Adam things. Michael says Michael things. It’s a 1upsmanship episode!

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Bloodborne (Feat. Zach Ryan)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Bloodborne (Feat. Zach Ryan)
item.description:
Zach Ryan returns to discuss the 2015 masterpiece Bloodborne with the fellas. Grab your nearest blood-based weapon and down a few blood vials because it’s time to tackle some heated discussion over the legacy of the game. The hosts discuss its insane story, complexity of games in general, and everyone’s feelings on how good games do optional quests/bosses well.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Doom Eternal (Feat. Tom Reimann)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Doom Eternal (Feat. Tom Reimann)
item.description:
The Rhyme Man is back, baby! Let’s get that going as a thing! The Rhyme Man! Did this recent update of the Doom franchise improve the basic game mechanics? Does the lore add much to the game? How do we all feel about “The Rhyme Man?” Most of these questions are answered and more!

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Disco Elysium
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Disco Elysium
item.description:
“What kind of cop are you?” That’s a real loaded question, game studio ZA/UM. First, I’m not a cop. Who said I was a cop? And second, maybe to answer that question we’ll have to get into 1800s-esque geopolitical fiction. And maybe make Michael cry. That’s right! This game opened the floodgates of both Michael’s physical tear ducts and the more philosophical ethical sparring of our hosts, Mike and Adam. Listen to hear what they think and where they disagree.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Rocket League (Feat. Abe Epperson)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Rocket League (Feat. Abe Epperson)
item.description:
Michael and Adam considered all their friends and determined that the best Rocket Leaguer of them all is Abe Epperson. Turns out, he’s also bad! They’re all bad! Considering it’s a six-year-old game that still appears to be streamed by many, you’d expect they’d get a guest who’s better at the game. Though it doesn’t help that it’s one of the most challenging learning curves in modern gaming. So let’s chat about what makes Rocket League special and why it still remains relevant.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Psychonauts
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Psychonauts
item.description:
Child Michael Swaim visits this episode of 1upsmanship and demands that his co-host plays his favorite game from his formative years. Adam, who wants everyone to know that he does not like Final Fantasy and “sparkly anime boys,” and while that has nothing to do with Psychonauts, would not play this game if left to his own devices. Will Adam break child Michael’s heart and hate this game or will the stars in Swaim’s eyes win over his cold heart? Or is Michael completely wrong and this game can be deleted from history? Listen to find out!

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Cyberpunk 2077 (Feat. Max Scoville)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Cyberpunk 2077 (Feat. Max Scoville)
item.description:
Max Scoville, another friend/host/podcaster from IGN, joins Michael and Adam to discuss the hopeful hit of 2020, Cyberpunk 2077. Months after the game’s launch, which was sensationalized by its bugs and recalls, can we look at the game with more objective eyes or will it never recover, kid? Well, Samurai, eavesdrop on whether or not this game was worth its decade-long development.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 1+2 (Feat. Vanessa Gritton)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 1+2 (Feat. Vanessa Gritton)
item.description:
Vanessa Gritton joins the co-hosts for the recent remastering of the OG and sequel of the classic Tony Hawk Pro Skater franchise. The gang reminiscences on the changes from the original releases and how brands change over time. Though, they all agree it’s worth letting the nostalgia do a sweet pop shove-it over your face. I know you wish you could choose Rodney Mullen, but you’re left with Michael, Adam, and Vanessa. Sorry. Also, Vanessa explains why she’s a wiener. Adam explains what being rad is.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Death Stranding
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Death Stranding
item.description:
Get ready for Michael and Adam (the Uppers) to have some contention. Michael waxes poetic about the power of this video game’s story and the experience he had while playing it. Adam on the other hand hated the game. Uh oh. Depending on how you land on the game, hopefully, this discussion will elucidate the highs and lows of this apparently divisive title, pee and all. Honestly though, let’s just listen to Swaim talk about the beauty of the game.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Luigi’s Mansion 3
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Luigi’s Mansion 3
item.description:
Michael and Adam take a break from the real world and discuss the beautiful world of being the brother that will never be first place. They discuss how in this game you play as a lean, green, ghost-bustin’ machine who projects a goo-version of himself, which is what cum is! Michael believes that this episode suffers from the game being “good, but nothing to talk about.” Let’s see if Adam can bring the fire and convince Michael that there’s more than meets the eye (that follows you around).

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Limbo & Inside (Feat. Daniel Vincent Gordh)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Limbo & Inside (Feat. Daniel Vincent Gordh)
item.description:
Adam and Michael are joined by fellow actor, writer, and longtime bean: Daniel Vincent Gordh. This time they discuss TWO titles from the developer Playdead. It’s a double feature! The simplicity and efficiency of these games push the visual concepts to the forefront. Beautifully animated and designed, both games feature ambiguous plots and endings. Does this affect the enjoyment of the game? Can our 1uppers put their finger on what makes these particular indie games memorable? Listen on and don’t get stabbed by the legs of a horrifying spider monster or get devoured by watchdogs.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Xbox vs. Playstation 2
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Xbox vs. Playstation 2
item.description:
Whoa, what an episode. Michael and Adam make the cases for the cases that hold our gaming history. Let's examine the culture, the economics, the hardware, and the games through the lens of two very different gamers defending what made the system's special. Unfortunately, once they complete the segment "Keep or Delete" most of us will have to erase half of our formative gaming memories.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Destiny 2 (Feat. Robert Brockway)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Destiny 2 (Feat. Robert Brockway)
item.description:
Michael and Adam sit down with ex-cracked alum Robert Brockway and pick up the sweet loot that is his opinion and critiques of Destiny 2. Adam is unapologetic about his love for this game. Can he brave the raid of Michael and Robert's opinions? Does Destiny 2 do a crappy job curating missions? Are video games better than huge orgies? You'll have to ask Michael's 72-year-old dad about that last one!

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Uncharted 4 (Feat. David C Bell)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Uncharted 4 (Feat. David C Bell)
item.description:
Michael and Adam sit down with soon-to-be doxxed David C Bell and discuss the only Naughty Dog production about pirates that hide crates on wheels on a deserted island: Uncharted 4. Does Nathan Drake have PTSD from all his murders and puzzle-based close calls? Could the treasure hunters leave the island and just return with stuff to make their job easier? Is the crypt with the exploding mummies the worst part of the game? Is Dave's new nickname Sweet Meat? These are the hard-hitting questions our hosts and guest must navigate to find the much-coveted treasure that is "keep or delete."

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Titanfall 2
item.description:
If the IMC spends all its resources making mechs in the war for more resources, does a titan shed a tear? Adam and Michael strap on their grappling hooks and wall walk around the story and insane politics of Titanfall 2, somehow drawing a parallel to EA in general. Luckily, they include a discussion of the value of a good FPS movement mechanic and what makes them work.

item.description:
Michael and Adam dispense with the niceties and go Fanboy a Fanboy in this uniquely-formatted episode of 1Upsmanship that aims to determine which was the more impactful system: The Sega Genesis, or the Super Nintendo Entertainment System. HINT: Things get dicey, it's the Genesis, and Michael wrote this copy.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Minecraft (Feat. Cody Johnston)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Minecraft (Feat. Cody Johnston)
item.description:
Cody Johnston of Some More News stops by to discuss the Cracked Cigarette Tree and how it relates to one of the more important games ever made. A truly crafty deep-dive into the mine of gaming, friendship, and the ways in which our relationship to virtual cubes says a lot about who we are as people, you know?

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Fallout - New Vegas (Feat. Vanessa Gritton)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Fallout - New Vegas (Feat. Vanessa Gritton)
item.description:
In their most explosive dust-up so far, Adam and Michael square off to demolish and enshrine (respectively), Michael's favorite game that Adam also played and thinks is just fine! Gamer and comedian Vanessa Gritton joins to incite violence, Michael nerds up the end with a Fallout rap, and Adam and Mike's friendship is forced to bust out a couple of stimpaks to survive.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: 1Upsmanship: Fallout 4 (Feat. Vanessa Gritton)
item.itunes:title: 1Upsmanship: Fallout 4 (Feat. Vanessa Gritton)
item.description:
Do synths dream of synthetic sheep? And if so, does that justify their total enslavement for the purposes of salvaging an apocalypse-ridden post war 1950's-style Earth? Vanessa Gritton joins Michael and Adam to parse the philosophy of Fallout 4, burn Boston, and argue about the potential future of the franchise.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
